HQ CIRCULATION RECORD.W.M.(kk) I67th CONCLUSIONS.WEDNESDAY. 13th DECEMBER. 19kh - 5.30 Em.ifThis meeting arose out of^suggestion madeby the Minister of Labour at the meeting of the WarCabinet held on Monday, 11th December, 19Uh at 12 Noon(W.W,(lih) 163rd Conclusions, Minute 1 - see note appendedthereto).In the discussion on Wednesday, 13th December,the Chief of the Imperial General Staff informed theWar Cabinet of the discussion which the Prime Ministerand the Chiefs of staff had had with General Eisenhoweron the previous day. In this the two probable lines of attack were mentioned.The Chief of the Imperial General Staff made itclear that he feared lest there might be a tendency to make these two thrusts of equal weight, whereas,in his view,it was essential that one of these thrusts should be themain thrust and have behind it sufficient force to ensurethe conclusion.The date at which operations across the Rhinewere likely to be started was mentioned.The war Cabinet took note of the information given them but no conclusion was recorded. It was agreed that further meetings of the same nature should be held atmonthly intervals for the present on the middle Wednesdayof each month.Offices of the War Cabinet, S.W.1.
